intro: Clidemia biserrata, commonly known as the velvetleaf or false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a velvety texture. It produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Clidemia biserrata is often found in moist, shaded areas and can be invasive in certain regions.
